intro: Gonolobus farenholtzii, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms.
